required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Single-center Randomized Study Evaluating Feasibility of Routine Bladder Catheterization After Mini- Percutaneous Nephrolithotripsy (PCNL)

lead_sponsor.agency: St. Petersburg State Pavlov Medical University

clinical_study.source: St. Petersburg State Pavlov Medical University

brief_summary.textblock:
60 patients
Inclusion Criteria:
- age from 18 to 70 years
- Indications for mini-PCNL
- ASA score: 1-3
- Single percutaneous access to pyelocaliceal system
- Size of solitary calculus up to 2.5 cm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active urinary tract infection
- Coagulopathy
- Clinically significant infravesical obstruction (Qmax less than 10 ml / s, PVR more than 50 ml)

detailed_description.textblock:
60 patients after PCNL will be recruited and randomized into 2 groups (30 vs 30):
- No Catheterization after mini-PCNL (study) - the bladder catheterization is not performed.
- Catheterization after mini-PCNL (control) - the bladder will be drained with the urethral catheter.
All patients will fill out the VASP in 2, 6, 12, 24 hours after mini-PCNL. Ultrasound examination of urinary bladder will be performed after mini-PCNL. All the AE will be registered.

primary_outcome.measure: To measure the level of pain in patients
primary_outcome.description: Filling out the VASP score after PCNL by all patients in 2, 6, 12 and 24 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: To register the AE regarding catheterization or absence of catheterization
secondary_outcome.description: Performing ultrasound examination of urinary bladder after PCNL,

arm_group.description: After mini-PCNL standardized follow-up protocol supposes drainage the upper urinary tract with nephrostomy, tubeless (using ureteral stent without nephrostomy) or totally tubeless (no drainage) tactics. Bladder catheterization is not performed.

After mini-PCNL standardized follow-up protocol supposes drainage the upper urinary tract with nephrostomy, tubeless (using ureteral stent without nephrostomy) or totally tubeless (no drainage) tactics. The bladder is to be drained with the urethral catheter in all cases.

intervention.description: Installation of Foley catheter into the urinary bladder

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 to 70 years
- Indications for mini-PCNL
- ASA score: 1-3
- Single percutaneous access to pyelocaliceal system
- Size of solitary stone up to 2.5 cm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active urinary tract infection
- Coagulopathy
- Clinically significant infravesical obstruction (Qmax less than 10 ml / s, PVR more than 50 ml)
